1.notes: SCIE 113, ENGL 110, ENGL 111, ENGL 112, ENGL 120, ENGL 121, WRDS 150

Students without one of Biology 11 or Biology 12 must take BIOL_V 111 before taking BIOL_V 112 or BIOL_V 121. Students without Chemistry 12 must take CHEM_V 100 or CHEM_V 111 before taking BIOL_V 112.
Students who do not have BC high school Chemistry 12 (or its equivalent) must write the UBC Chemistry Basic Skills Test and may be required to take CHEM_V 100.

MATH_V 110, 120, 180 or 184 may substitute for any of the specified calculus courses. The extra credit for these courses with more than 3 credits would count as part of the elective credit in later years.
MATH_V 121 may substitute for any of the specified integral calculus courses.
Chosen from PHYS_V courses excluding PHYS_V 100. Students lacking Physics 12 must take PHYS_V 100 as an elective before taking other PHYS_V courses.

2.notes: CAPS_V 301 may be taken instead of CAPS_V 205 and CAPS_V 206; in the year where this requirement is not completed, increase the number of elective credits by 6.
CAPS_V 301 may be taken instead of CAPS_V 205 and CAPS_V 206; in the year where this requirement is not completed, increase the number of elective credits by 6.
Students who take CHEM_V 211 reduce the number of elective credits by 1.
The combination of CHEM_V 203 and 213 are accepted as a substitute for CHEM_V 233 and 235 if students have credit for CHEM_V 203 and 213.

Elective credits together with required courses must fulfill the Faculty of Science’s: a) Foundational Requirement ; b) Laboratory Science Requirement ; c) Science Breadth Requirement ; d) Science and Arts Requirements ; e) Upper-level Requirement ; f) General Degree Requirements .
